title: Everyday English Course 115
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

questionTemplates.text:
W: Don't forget to write to me, John.
M: I won't. But let me make sure I have the right address. Is it 42 West street Birmingham?
W: That's right. By the way, my office number has changed since I began to work at Birmingham.
M: Has it? And tell me what it is, then?
{a}

answerOptions: The man wants to meet Tom in Hawaii.

The man is leaving for Hawaii.

answerOptions: He meant she should make a phone call if anything went wrong.
He meant for her just to wait till help came.
He was afraid something would go wrong with her car.
instances.correctAnswer: He meant she should make a phone call if anything went wrong.

variables.a: What does the man really mean?
Where will the speakers probably go?
Where are the speakers going?

questionTemplates.text:
M: What happened to you last night? We waited but you didn't show up.
W: The police took my family's dog because I didn't have a license for it. I had to spend the whole night looking for a new dog that looked the same as the old one.
M: Really? That's crazy.
W: Look, could you keep this a secret? My parents loved the old dog. I don't want them to hear I bought a new one.
{a}

answerOptions: The woman managed to give the police a wrong dog.
The woman was caught by the police because she didn't have a driving license.
The woman tried very hard to find a new dog to make her parents happy.
instances.correctAnswer: The woman tried very hard to find a new dog to make her parents happy.

variables.a: What can we learn about the woman from the conversation?

M: They are very convenient. We'll arrange everything for you.
